questions.text: Which of the following drugs is commonly used for hormone replacement therapy in post menopausal women to alleviate menopausal symptoms?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Estrogen/ progestin combination therapy

Explanation:

  • • Estrogen/ progestin therapy is commonly used as HRT to alleviate post-menopausal symptoms Estrogen primarily alleviates symptoms and progesterone is added to protect the lining of the uterus and reduces the risk of endometrial hyperplasia and cancer
  • • Estrogen/ progestin therapy is commonly used as HRT to alleviate post-menopausal symptoms
  • • Estrogen primarily alleviates symptoms and progesterone is added to protect the lining of the uterus and reduces the risk of endometrial hyperplasia and cancer
  • • Other Options
  • • Other Options
  • • Option A: SSRIs are not standard therapy for post-menopausal symptoms but may be prescribed in specific cases to address mood relate menopausal symptoms Option B: Bisphosphonates are medications used to prevent and treat osteoporosis Option C: GnRH agonists are not used for HRT
  • • Option A: SSRIs are not standard therapy for post-menopausal symptoms but may be prescribed in specific cases to address mood relate menopausal symptoms
  • • Option B: Bisphosphonates are medications used to prevent and treat osteoporosis
  • • Option C: GnRH agonists are not used for HRT

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Estrogen/ progestin therapy is commonly used as HRT to alleviate post-menopausal symptoms Estrogen primarily alleviates symptoms and progesterone is added to protect the lining of the uterus and reduces the risk of endometrial hyperplasia and cancer So in women who have a uterus, in HRT: Estrogen + Progesterone both are given In women without a uterus (post hysterectomy): in HRT, only estrogen is suffiecient
  • ➤ Estrogen/ progestin therapy is commonly used as HRT to alleviate post-menopausal symptoms
  • ➤ Estrogen primarily alleviates symptoms and progesterone is added to protect the lining of the uterus and reduces the risk of endometrial hyperplasia and cancer So in women who have a uterus, in HRT: Estrogen + Progesterone both are given In women without a uterus (post hysterectomy): in HRT, only estrogen is suffiecient
  • ➤ So in women who have a uterus, in HRT: Estrogen + Progesterone both are given In women without a uterus (post hysterectomy): in HRT, only estrogen is suffiecient
  • ➤ So in women who have a uterus, in HRT: Estrogen + Progesterone both are given
  • ➤ In women without a uterus (post hysterectomy): in HRT, only estrogen is suffiecient
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 1420, Speroff’s Gynecology, 9 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 1420, Speroff’s Gynecology, 9 th edition

questions.text: A 42-year woman presents with heavy menstrual bleeding and dysmenorrhoea. Pelvic ultrasound reveals an intramural fibroid measuring 3 cm. The woman desires medical management rather than surgical intervention. Which of the following would be the most appropriate 1 st line drug in this woman?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Antifibrinolytic with NSAID

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fibroids can be managed medically or surgically or by newer techniques
  • ➤ Fibroids can be managed medically or surgically or by newer techniques
  • ➤ Drugs for Medical Management
  • ➤ Drugs for Medical Management
  • ➤ NSAIDs Anti-fibrinolytics (Tranexamic acid)
  • ➤ NSAIDs
  • ➤ NSAIDs
  • ➤ Anti-fibrinolytics (Tranexamic acid)
  • ➤ Anti-fibrinolytics (Tranexamic acid)
  • ➤ A combination of Antibrinolytic and NSAIDs are usually tried as a 1 st line management in women with HMB and dysmenorrhoea
  • ➤ 3. Combined Estrogen and Progesterones: these are effective in reducing bleeding and pain during periods in women with fibroids.
  • ➤ 3. Combined Estrogen and Progesterones:
  • ➤ 4. SPRMs: Mifepristone (RU 486) and Ulipristal acetate
  • ➤ 4. SPRMs:
  • ➤ Is very effective to reduce fibroid size and also menorrhagia. It reduces the size of the fibroid significantly. Long-term therapy with mifepristone is avoided as it causes endometrial hyperplasia. Ulipristal acetate is also used for 3 months. IT is associated with liver toxicity
  • ➤ Is very effective to reduce fibroid size and also menorrhagia.
  • ➤ It reduces the size of the fibroid significantly.
  • ➤ Long-term therapy with mifepristone is avoided as it causes endometrial hyperplasia.
  • ➤ Ulipristal acetate is also used for 3 months. IT is associated with liver toxicity
  • ➤ 5. Danazol:
  • ➤ 5. Danazol:
  • ➤ Can reduce the volume of a fibroid slightly. Because of androgenic side effects, danazol is used only for a period of 3–6 months. Not commonly used now
  • ➤ Can reduce the volume of a fibroid slightly.
  • ➤ Because of androgenic side effects, danazol is used only for a period of 3–6 months.
  • ➤ Not commonly used now
  • ➤ 6. GnRH agonists:
  • ➤ 6. GnRH agonists:
  • ➤ Drugs commonly used are goserelin, leprolin, buserelin or nafarelin Mechanism of action is sustained pituitary down regulation and suppression of ovarian function. Optimal duration of therapy is 3 months. Addback therapy may be needed to combat hypoestrogenic symptoms Reduces size of fibroid by upto 50% at 3 months
  • ➤ Drugs commonly used are goserelin, leprolin, buserelin or nafarelin
  • ➤ Mechanism of action is sustained pituitary down regulation and suppression of ovarian function.
  • ➤ Optimal duration of therapy is 3 months.
  • ➤ Addback therapy may be needed to combat hypoestrogenic symptoms
  • ➤ Reduces size of fibroid by upto 50% at 3 months
  • ➤ 7. GnRH antagonists
  • ➤ 7. GnRH antagonists
  • ➤ Cetrorelix or ganirelix causes immediate suppression of pituitary and the ovaries. They do not have the initial stimulatory effect. Benefits are same as that of agonists Onset of amenorrhea is rapid.
  • ➤ Cetrorelix or ganirelix causes immediate suppression of pituitary and the ovaries.
  • ➤ They do not have the initial stimulatory effect. Benefits are same as that of agonists
  • ➤ Onset of amenorrhea is rapid.
  • ➤ 8. Levonorgestrel-releasing Intrauterine System (LNG-IUS):
  • ➤ 8. Levonorgestrel-releasing Intrauterine System (LNG-IUS):
  • ➤ Reduces blood loss and uterine size. However, this is not recommended when the uterine size is >12 weeks or if the cavity is distorted.
  • ➤ Reduces blood loss and uterine size.
  • ➤ However, this is not recommended when the uterine size is >12 weeks or if the cavity is distorted.
  • ➤ Ref: page 209, Williams Gynecology 3 rd edition
  • ➤ Ref: page 209, Williams Gynecology 3 rd edition

questions.text: Which of the following progesterone medications is commonly used in HRT in menopausal women to protect the uterus from the potential risks of estrogen therapy?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Medroxyprogesterone acetate

Explanation:

  • • Explanation
  • • Hormone replacement therapy (HRT) consists of Estrogen and Progesterone Medroxyprogesterone acetate is the most commonly used progesterone component for menopausal women, and this is given to protect the uterus from hyperplasia/ malignancy Conjugated equine estrogen is the most common estrogen used in HRT
  • • Hormone replacement therapy (HRT) consists of Estrogen and Progesterone
  • • Medroxyprogesterone acetate is the most commonly used progesterone component for menopausal women, and this is given to protect the uterus from hyperplasia/ malignancy
  • • Conjugated equine estrogen is the most common estrogen used in HRT
  • • Other Options
  • • Other Options
  • • Option B: Micronized progesterone is commonly used in pregnancy in women at risk of preterm labor Option C: Norethindrone and Option D : levonorgestrel are usually part of combined contraceptive pills. LNG is also used as an intra uterine device (Mirena)
  • • Option B: Micronized progesterone is commonly used in pregnancy in women at risk of preterm labor
  • • Option B:
  • • Option C: Norethindrone and Option D : levonorgestrel are usually part of combined contraceptive pills. LNG is also used as an intra uterine device (Mirena)
  • • Option C:
  • • Option D

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hormone replacement therapy (HRT) consists of Estrogen and Progesterone Medroxyprogesterone acetate is the most commonly used progesterone component for menopausal women, and this is given to protect the uterus from hyperplasia/ malignancy
  • ➤ Hormone replacement therapy (HRT) consists of Estrogen and Progesterone
  • ➤ Medroxyprogesterone acetate is the most commonly used progesterone component for menopausal women, and this is given to protect the uterus from hyperplasia/ malignancy
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 1420, Speroff’s Gynecology, 9 th edition
  • ➤ Ref: Page no 1420, Speroff’s Gynecology, 9 th edition

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman presents with infertility and is diagnosed with anovulatory cycles. Which of the following medications can be used for ovulation induction in this patient?
questions.correct_answer: C. Both clomiphene citrate and letrozole
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. Both clomiphene citrate and letrozole

Explanation:

  • • A. Clomiphene citrate is a selective estrogen receptor modulator (SERM) that blocks the negative feedback of estrogen on the hypothalamus, leading to increased production and release of follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH). This promotes follicular growth and ovulation.
  • • B. Letrozole is an aromatase inhibitor that reduces the conversion of androgens to estrogen, leading to decreased estrogen levels and increased FSH production. It has been found to be equally effective or even superior to clomiphene citrate in some cases, particularly in women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).
  • • Hence Option C (Option A + B) is the answer
  • • Hence Option C (Option A + B) is the answer
  • • Other Options
  • • Option D. Gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) agonists are not typically used for primary ovulation induction. They are more commonly used to suppress ovulation temporarily in certain fertility treatment protocols or for medical management of specific conditions, such as endometriosis.
  • • Option D.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Both letrozole and clomiphene citrate are commonly used ovulation induction agents. Gonadotropins (FSH and HMG) are 2nd line drugs. The choice between clomiphene citrate and letrozole may depend on various factors, including the patient's individual characteristics, response to prior treatments, and underlying conditions such as PCOS. In some cases, a healthcare provider may choose to use one medication over the other based on individual patient factors. Rememebr: If PCOS is mentioned, Letrozole would be the preferred agent for ovulation induction, even though clomiohene citrate can also be used
  • ➤ Both letrozole and clomiphene citrate are commonly used ovulation induction agents. Gonadotropins (FSH and HMG) are 2nd line drugs.
  • ➤ Both letrozole and clomiphene citrate are commonly used ovulation induction agents. Gonadotropins (FSH and HMG) are 2nd line drugs.
  • ➤ The choice between clomiphene citrate and letrozole may depend on various factors, including the patient's individual characteristics, response to prior treatments, and underlying conditions such as PCOS. In some cases, a healthcare provider may choose to use one medication over the other based on individual patient factors.
  • ➤ Rememebr: If PCOS is mentioned, Letrozole would be the preferred agent for ovulation induction, even though clomiohene citrate can also be used
  • ➤ Rememebr:

questions.text: Match the following drugs used in gynecology with their corresponding indication of use:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. A-1 B-2 C-4 D-3

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Dienogest is a progesterone; used in management of endometriosis (either alone or in combination with estrogen) Letrozole is commonly used for ovulation induction, but recent WHO guidelines have recommended its use in 1 st trimester MTP along with misoprostol Ulipristal acetate (SPRM) has 2 uses: Emergency contraceptive and medica management of fibroids Tamoxifen: treatment of hormone receptor positive breast cancer; causes endometrial hyperplasia
  • • Dienogest is a progesterone; used in management of endometriosis (either alone or in combination with estrogen)
  • • Letrozole is commonly used for ovulation induction, but recent WHO guidelines have recommended its use in 1 st trimester MTP along with misoprostol
  • • Ulipristal acetate (SPRM) has 2 uses: Emergency contraceptive and medica management of fibroids
  • • Tamoxifen: treatment of hormone receptor positive breast cancer; causes endometrial hyperplasia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Dienogest is a progesterone; used in management of endometriosis (either alone or in combination with estrogen)
  • ➤ Letrozole is commonly used for ovulation induction, but recent WHO guidelines have recommended its use in 1 st trimester MTP along with misoprostol
  • ➤ Ulipristal acetate (SPRM) has 2 uses: Emergency contraceptive and medica management of fibroids
  • ➤ Tamoxifen: treatment of hormone receptor positive breast cancer; causes endometrial hyperplasia

questions.text: Which of the following is a correct indication for the use of gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) agonists in gynecology?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Treatment of endometriosis

Explanation:

  • • Gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) agonists are commonly used in gynecology for the treatment of endometriosis. GnRH agonists work by initially stimulating the release of gonadotropins, which leads to an initial increase in estrogen production. However, with continued use, they suppress the production of gonadotropins, leading to a decrease in estrogen levels and subsequent reduction in the growth and symptoms associated with endometriosis. Other uses of GnRh agonists include Central precocious puberty IVF cycles (long protocol and also as a trigger in women at high risk of developing OHSS) Endometriosis Fibroid uterus AUB Hirsutism Pre-menstrual syndrome
  • • Gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH) agonists are commonly used in gynecology for the treatment of endometriosis. GnRH agonists work by initially stimulating the release of gonadotropins, which leads to an initial increase in estrogen production. However, with continued use, they suppress the production of gonadotropins, leading to a decrease in estrogen levels and subsequent reduction in the growth and symptoms associated with endometriosis. Other uses of GnRh agonists include Central precocious puberty IVF cycles (long protocol and also as a trigger in women at high risk of developing OHSS) Endometriosis Fibroid uterus AUB Hirsutism Pre-menstrual syndrome
  • • Central precocious puberty IVF cycles (long protocol and also as a trigger in women at high risk of developing OHSS) Endometriosis Fibroid uterus AUB Hirsutism Pre-menstrual syndrome
  • • Central precocious puberty
  • • IVF cycles (long protocol and also as a trigger in women at high risk of developing OHSS)
  • • Endometriosis
  • • Fibroid uterus
  • • AUB
  • • Hirsutism
  • • Pre-menstrual syndrome
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B: Ovulation induction in infertility: Drug of choice is clomiphene citrate and letrozole
  • • Option B:
  • • Option C: Hormone replacement therapy in menopause: Drug of choice is estrogen + progesterone
  • • Option C:
  • • Option D: Management of polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS): Treatment is Lifestyle measures + Depending on the patients concerns:
  • • Option D:
  • • Infertility: Letrozole Delayed cycles: Combined OCPs (with preferably a 4th generation progesterone like drosperinone) Hirsutism: Antiandrogrens or an OCP with the progesterone component being an anti-androgen (like cyproterone acetate)
  • • Infertility: Letrozole
  • • Delayed cycles: Combined OCPs (with preferably a 4th generation progesterone like drosperinone)
  • • Hirsutism: Antiandrogrens or an OCP with the progesterone component being an anti-androgen (like cyproterone acetate)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Uses of GnRh agonists include Central precocious puberty IVF cycles (long protocol and also as a trigger in women at high risk of developing OHSS) Endometriosis Fibroid uterus AUB Hirsutism Pre-menstrual syndrome
  • ➤ Uses of GnRh agonists include Central precocious puberty IVF cycles (long protocol and also as a trigger in women at high risk of developing OHSS) Endometriosis Fibroid uterus AUB Hirsutism Pre-menstrual syndrome
  • ➤ Central precocious puberty IVF cycles (long protocol and also as a trigger in women at high risk of developing OHSS) Endometriosis Fibroid uterus AUB Hirsutism Pre-menstrual syndrome
  • ➤ Central precocious puberty
  • ➤ IVF cycles (long protocol and also as a trigger in women at high risk of developing OHSS)
  • ➤ Endometriosis
  • ➤ Fibroid uterus

questions.text: Which drug is found in the image shown?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. Levonorgestrel

Explanation:

  • • The image is an intra-uterine device which contains Levonorgestrel (MIRENA) Mirena is a type of Levonorgestrel – Intrauterine System (LNG-IUS) It contains levonorgestrel – 52 mg in total with a release rate of 20μg/ day Effective life: 5 years (In 2023, the manufacturer extended its use as a contraceptive to 8 years) Uses: Contraception Non contraceptive uses (Mnemonic : Mirena S a f ekeeps End angered A nimals) End ometriosis S ymptomatic fibroid (not distorting the cavity) End ometrial hyperplasia A denomyosis Contraindications to Mirena: Unexplained uterine or vaginal bleeding Post abortal sepsis Puerperal sepsis Endometrial cancer Cervical cancer Gestational trophoblastic neoplasia Current Pelvic inflammatory disease Genital Tuberculosis Large fibroid distorting the uterine cavity Mullerian anomalies distorting the uterine cavity

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding ormeloxifene is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Ormeloxifene is a selective progesterone receptor modulator (SPRM)

options.label: B
options.text: Ormeloxifene is primarily used as an emergency contraceptive

options.label: C
options.text: Ormeloxifene is approved for long-term contraception and the treatment of heavy menstrual bleeding

options.label: D
options.text: Ormeloxifene is contraindicated in women with a history of breast cancer.

questions.correct_answer: C. Ormeloxifene is approved for long-term contraception and the treatment of heavy menstrual bleeding
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. Ormeloxifene is approved for long-term contraception and the treatment of heavy menstrual bleeding.

Explanation:

  • • Ormeloxifene is commonly known as CENTCHROMAN/ CHHAYA
  • • It is a selective estrogen receptor modulator (SERM) Developed by the Central Drug Research Institute, Lucknow It is a non – hormonal, synthetic contraceptive Low cost Initially marketed as Saheli and now as Chhaya by the Govt of India Contains 30 mg Recommended dose for contraception: 1 tablet twice weekly from the 1 st day of menstruation for 3 months followed by once a week It has recently been used as a drug for heavy menstrual bleeding 99% effective Contra-indications to Ormeloxifene PCOS (Absolutely c/i) Liver disease (Absolutely c/i) DVT (Relatively c/i) SLE (Relatively c/i) Migraine with aura (Relatively c/i)
  • • It is a selective estrogen receptor modulator (SERM)
  • • Developed by the Central Drug Research Institute, Lucknow
  • • It is a non – hormonal, synthetic contraceptive
  • • Low cost
  • • Initially marketed as Saheli and now as Chhaya by the Govt of India
  • • Contains 30 mg
  • • Recommended dose for contraception: 1 tablet twice weekly from the 1 st day of menstruation for 3 months followed by once a week
  • • It has recently been used as a drug for heavy menstrual bleeding
  • • 99% effective
  • • Contra-indications to Ormeloxifene PCOS (Absolutely c/i) Liver disease (Absolutely c/i) DVT (Relatively c/i) SLE (Relatively c/i) Migraine with aura (Relatively c/i)
  • • Contra-indications to Ormeloxifene
  • • PCOS (Absolutely c/i) Liver disease (Absolutely c/i) DVT (Relatively c/i) SLE (Relatively c/i) Migraine with aura (Relatively c/i)
  • • PCOS (Absolutely c/i)
  • • Liver disease (Absolutely c/i)
  • • DVT (Relatively c/i)
  • • SLE (Relatively c/i)
  • • Migraine with aura (Relatively c/i)
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option A: Ormeloxifene is a selective progesterone receptor modulator (SPRM): It is an SERM
  • • Option A:
  • • Option B: Ormeloxifene is primarily used as an emergency contraceptive: It is not used as an emergency contraceptive. LNG, Combined OCPs and Uliprostal are used as emergency contracpetives
  • • Option B:
  • • Option C: Ormeloxifene is contraindicated in women with a history of breast cancer: Ormeloxifene is not contra-indicated in breast cancer; it is MEC 2 (benefits outweigh the risks) and can be safely given
  • • Option C:

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

  • ➤ 99% effective
  • ➤ Contra-indications to Ormeloxifene PCOS (Absolutely c/i) Liver disease (Absolutely c/i) DVT (Relatively c/i) SLE (Relatively c/i) Migraine with aura (Relatively c/i)

questions.text: Match the name of the contraceptive (as made available by the Govt of India) with the drug it contains:
questions.explanation:

questions.text: In the management of endometriosis, which of the following is the primary mechanism of action of danazol?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Explanation
  • • Danazol is an isoxazole derivative of 17-alpha ethinyl testosterone. It is strictly anti-gonadotropin but acts as an androgen agonist. Mode of action: The mechanism of action is complex and includes the following: Acting on the hypothalamo-pituitary gonadal axis → depression of frequency of GnRH pulses → suppression of pituitary FSH and LH surge. There is, however, no change in the basal gonadotropin level while the estrogen levels are reduced. Reduces the liver synthesis of SHBG and as such, free testosterone is increased which in turn causes endometrial atrophy. Acts directly on the ovaries, inhibiting the enzymes responsible for steroidogenesis – reducing the estrogen level Binds with steroid receptors on the endometrium and also in the ectopic endometrial sites Immunologic effects of danazol include decrease in serum immunoglobulins, interleukin-1 and TNF production. This effect helps in the regression of endometriosis. The net result is production of an hypoestrogenic state Indications of use of Danazol: (Although it is now not very commonly used)
  • • Danazol is an isoxazole derivative of 17-alpha ethinyl testosterone.
  • • It is strictly anti-gonadotropin but acts as an androgen agonist.
  • • Mode of action: The mechanism of action is complex and includes the following: Acting on the hypothalamo-pituitary gonadal axis → depression of frequency of GnRH pulses → suppression of pituitary FSH and LH surge. There is, however, no change in the basal gonadotropin level while the estrogen levels are reduced. Reduces the liver synthesis of SHBG and as such, free testosterone is increased which in turn causes endometrial atrophy. Acts directly on the ovaries, inhibiting the enzymes responsible for steroidogenesis – reducing the estrogen level Binds with steroid receptors on the endometrium and also in the ectopic endometrial sites Immunologic effects of danazol include decrease in serum immunoglobulins, interleukin-1 and TNF production. This effect helps in the regression of endometriosis.
  • • Acting on the hypothalamo-pituitary gonadal axis → depression of frequency of GnRH pulses → suppression of pituitary FSH and LH surge. There is, however, no change in the basal gonadotropin level while the estrogen levels are reduced. Reduces the liver synthesis of SHBG and as such, free testosterone is increased which in turn causes endometrial atrophy. Acts directly on the ovaries, inhibiting the enzymes responsible for steroidogenesis – reducing the estrogen level Binds with steroid receptors on the endometrium and also in the ectopic endometrial sites Immunologic effects of danazol include decrease in serum immunoglobulins, interleukin-1 and TNF production. This effect helps in the regression of endometriosis.
  • • Acting on the hypothalamo-pituitary gonadal axis → depression of frequency of GnRH pulses → suppression of pituitary FSH and LH surge. There is, however, no change in the basal gonadotropin level while the estrogen levels are reduced.
  • • Reduces the liver synthesis of SHBG and as such, free testosterone is increased which in turn causes endometrial atrophy.
  • • Acts directly on the ovaries, inhibiting the enzymes responsible for steroidogenesis – reducing the estrogen level
  • • Binds with steroid receptors on the endometrium and also in the ectopic endometrial sites
  • • Immunologic effects of danazol include decrease in serum immunoglobulins, interleukin-1 and TNF production. This effect helps in the regression of endometriosis.
  • • The net result is production of an hypoestrogenic state
  • • The net result is production of an hypoestrogenic state
  • • Indications of use of Danazol: (Although it is now not very commonly used)
  • • Indications of use of Danazol: (Although it is now not very commonly used)
  • • Endometriosis Precocious puberty AUB PMS Symptomatic fibroid Benign fibrocystic disease of the breasts (mastalgia) Prior to hysteroscopic endometrial ablation, to make the endometrium thin

  • • Precocious puberty
  • • AUB
  • • PMS
  • • Symptomatic fibroid
  • • Benign fibrocystic disease of the breasts (mastalgia)

questions.text: Which of the following medications can be added to improve the clomiphene response in women with PCOS?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. Metformin

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Many women with PCOS also have insulin resistance Insulin resistance leads to compensatory hyperinsulinemia and dyslipidemia. Interventions that reduce circulating insulin levels in women with PCOS may restore normal reproductive endocrine function. Insulin-sensitizing agents like Metformin help in the treatment of PCOS. Metformin administered to women with PCOS, increased the frequency of spontaneous ovulation, menstrual cyclicity, and ovulatory response to Clomiphene citrate
  • • Many women with PCOS also have insulin resistance
  • • Insulin resistance leads to compensatory hyperinsulinemia and dyslipidemia.
  • • Interventions that reduce circulating insulin levels in women with PCOS may restore normal reproductive endocrine function.
  • • Insulin-sensitizing agents like Metformin help in the treatment of PCOS.
  • • Metformin administered to women with PCOS, increased the frequency of spontaneous ovulation, menstrual cyclicity, and ovulatory response to Clomiphene citrate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Metformin administered to women with PCOS, increased the frequency of spontaneous ovulation, menstrual cyclicity, and ovulatory response to Clomiphene citrate
